results.description:
Girlfriends Pray (GP) Local is everywhere, for every woman, in every season of her life! Once a month our Local Ambassadors host a Saturday morning meet-up in cities all around the world to discuss prayer, and connect with women in their local communities for fellowship, food, and fun on the strength of our faith.
It is the mission of Girlfriends Pray Ministries to get more women closer to God through prayer; and our vision is to get 1 million women around the world united in prayer. Although we are a non-traditional unconventional ministry with 80% of our service to women delivered virtually, in 2015 we expanded our service to women nationally and internationally off-line with our LIVE Breakfast Book Club (BBC) prayer groups.

We encourage you to also partner with us as day after day we connect with women all around the global and come face-to-face with real life issues, challenges and the needs of women. So many women depend on Girlfriends Pray Ministries as a life line to God. Every day we see lives changed, lives impacted and souls led back to Jesus Christ through our local meet-ups and our prayer line, (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#.

Here's a testimony from one of our girlfriends, Courtney -- “For those of you just joining Girlfriends Pray, if it had not been for God and this prayer line on my side …. Where would I be … in the grave by my own hand!”
We thank you in advance for joining us and your financial gift as an offering for the ongoing support of Girlfriends Pray Ministries. To become a partner please CLICK HERE.

We look forward to meeting you face-to-face at our next monthly meet-up.

Blessings,

Girlfriends Pray Local Ambassador Leadership Team
Praying Without Ceasing.... 1 Thessalonians 5:17
Girlfriends Pray Ministries
Prayer Line: (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#
Email: Local@GirlfriendsPray.org
www.GirlfriendsPray.org
@GirlfriendsPray
results.name: Girlfriends Pray Pittsburgh PA – Breakfast Book Club (BBC)

results.description: Why is Coltrane such a towering figure in jazz? We will listen to his music, read about his life, and take an indepth look at his genius. Monthly meetings now through a celebration of his 90th birthday on September 23, 2016.
results.name: John Coltrane: Indepth

topics.name: Emergency Preparedness for a Natural Disaster

results.description: My name is Steven Harris. I have been teaching preparedness since 1990's. A lot of it in Michigan and Virginia. I'm now here in greater Pittsburgh PA and I have found ZERO REAL Preparedness Groups. Some great ONLINE ones, but I want one like my buddies have in Texas. A group that meets each month. Teaches something each month. Organizes Trips and Classes. Classes on REAL Tactical Weapons (Pistol, Carbine, Shotgun). NOT just an "NRA Level 1A class" but a tactical class that will have you shooting 400-600 rounds per day. When someone in the group is going to butcher rabbits or get in a shipment of Chicks or Ducklings I want them to feel welcome and open enough to invite over those from the group that want to learn. For those who run a big garden, want a bunch of help planting? I want those in the group that want to learn planting to be able to come over and help you plant. I want it to be a community from the community. Come to the 1st Meeting, probably at the Pine Twp Community Center on April 28th 2016 7pm - 9pm. We ONLY have room for 50 people. If you are coming, you MUST sign up for the meeting at http://bit.ly/PittPrepGroup PLEASE share this on facebook and spread the work to your friends. We have a facebook page at http://tinyurl.com/zmkvb2l Some of the things that we will be teaching are: Food Storge that really works, starting easy. Emergency cooking Easy storage of water Bugout bags and get home bags Emergency Battery for My House Generator Power for My Home How to Safely store Gasoline Alternative and Emergency Heating Solar power How to Keep my Refrigerator and Freezer Cold Basic First Aid and Disaster Medicine Cell Phones, Police Scanners, CB Radios and other communications Home Security Systems and Lighting Defensive Tactical Pistol, Carbine and Shotgun Financial Security and Investing for Preppers Gardening - Food Plots Verticle Gardening Permaculture Gardening and Food Forests Animals such as Chicens, Ducks and Quail Animals such as Rabbits, Goats and Cows Preparedness for Car or Truck Hiking and other outdoor activities.
results.name: Wexford Emergency Preparedness Meetup - Pittsburgh Preppers

results.description:
This MeetUp group is for people in the Pittsburgh, PA area who speak and read (or would like to learn) Hindustani*!


Hindustani is an Indo-Aryan language, deriving primarily from the Khariboli dialect of Delhi, and incorporates a large amount of vocabulary from Sanskrit, Persian, Arabic, and Chagatai. It is a pluricentric language, with two official forms: Modern Standard Hindi and Modern Standard Urdu, which are its standardised registers, and which may be called Hindustani or Hindi-Urdu when taken together.


The colloquial languages are mutually intelligible and all but indistinguishable, and even though the official standards are nearly identical in grammar, they differ in literary conventions and in academic and technical vocabulary, with Urdu adopting stronger Persian, Turkic and Arabic influences, and Hindi relying more heavily on Sanskrit. Hindi is written in the Devanāgarī script, and Urdu is written in a modified Persian script (itself a modification of Arabic script).


*I am not a native speaker, but I hope that once a critical mass of interest is achieved, we can enroll native speakers to aid those of us who wish to learn!
results.name: Pittsburgh Hindi/Urdu/Hindustani Language Meetup

topics.name: Follow your Dreams and your Passions

results.description:
Read.Write.Love. is more than a Meetup, it's a movement for women of Faith who are climbing to lift others in their communities. We are women of faith who have accepted our callings as passionpreneurs, artists, community organizers, writers, instigators of change, and creatives who need a space to connect, be challenged and to grow forward! 

Sisterfriend, when you choose to surrender and begin to walk the divine path that He has chosen for you, you become unstoppable!  That said, I know from personal experience that the journey, while divinely created specifically for you, can be challenging and gets lonely at times.  Having a supportive group of bold, creative and courageous women is necessary for your sanity and success.  Engaging with like-minded sisterfriends who can encourage you in both your strengths and weaknesses and give feedback is a powerful way to connect with the woman you are at your core.  The environment sets the tone for an environment in which your vision and dream will begin to flourish.

So, lets DO THIS!

We come together twice a month for The Book Club, and for Masterminding (and the occasional Girls Night Out or IN) for fellowship, food & fun as we focus on mapping our missions! Here's what you can look forward to monthly: 

The Book Club: This is NOT your average book club. This book club is a space for Women on a Mission to come together and explore the ideas, strategies and stories of other women that will empower us to grow forward in a major way in our businesses and careers. Each month we will select a book and delve into how it applies to our journeys. Bring your journals and an open mind as we share inspiration and observations to impact both our own lives and each others.

Masterminding: Are you planning to launch your blog? Organizing a new community initiative? Preparing to open a business or go public with your "hustle"? Join us each month for creative, monthly in person mastermind sessions during which there may be a mini workshop, mission mapping, and ofcourse discussion and time to share Fun foods. Yes,  

Love & Hugs,

Tiff

Read.Write.Love. Community Housekeeping 

Please be considerate of time and effort of The Community Organizer as well as your fellow sisterfriends as you RSVP for meetups, as space is limited for each session.  If you RSVP, and are no longer able to attend, please change your RSVP from "Yes" to "No."  If you realize at the last minute (i.e. day of the event) that you aren't able to attend, please change your RSVP AND message the organizer.

*Downloading the Meetup App for your Smart Phone will make this super easy.
results.name: Read. Write. Love.

results.description:
**This group was formerly the Co-ed Writing  and Discussion group but has evolved to Night School!**

Welcome!

Do you enjoy learning?

Are you looking to meet interesting people doing cool stuff?

Do you have a passion you would like to share with others?

Then this group is for you!

This is a group for guys and girls of all ages and spaces in life.

We connect at least once a month to discuss things we're interested in, including love, relationships, health and well-being, sustainable living, and other topics du jour.  

We welcome group members to pose topics or to plan a workshop on something they are passionate about. Everyone should walk away with new knowledge, something to think about, or inspiration. 

(At the very least, come drink some tea or coffee and meet cool people!)

Hope you can make it!
results.name: Night School in Pittsburgh

topics.name: Small Business Networking and Referrals Services

results.description:
This Meetup is for women who are either new to the area or want to make new friends. 

I'm Janice Russell and I currently run two other Meetup groups, the Wexford Girls Happy Hour and the Pittsburgh Girls Happy Hour.

As my two Happy Hour groups have grown, I have noticed that many of the women were new to the area and were looking not only for networking opportunities and new friends, but also services like hairstylists, auto service, accountants, doctors, dentists, etc.  Based on that, I got the idea to start a “New to the North Hills” group to focus on getting women who are new to the area connected with the services they need.

With that in mind, I am going to come up with some creative venues where we can meet and begin looking for sponsors who might be interested in wining and dining you a little so they can tell you about their businesses and offer you discounts.

I guarantee we will have a good time and lots of laughs along the way.
results.name: New to the North Hills: A Social Networking Group for Women.

topics.name: Socializing Dogs, Off Leash Dog Recreation,

results.description:
This meetup is for all dog lovers in the Pittsburgh area! 

We'll have regular dog park meetups, hikes/walks, happy hours at dog friendly restaurants and bars. Plus we'll have unique events! If you have some fun suggestions just let us know! 

Its all organized by BarkHappy a startup for dog owners that will launch an app coming soon - its totally free and all about socializing dogs. We just want you and your dog to go more places and meet new friends! 

Be sure to use #barkhappy on your dogs pics on Instagram too follow us @barkhappy 

We'll let you know when its available here! For now lets start getting dogs together for some fun! 







note all meetups and events are completely voluntary and subject to our Terms & Conditions found here: 

http://barkhappy.com/terms/
results.name: Pittsburgh BarkHappy Dog Meetup

results.description:
If you often feel that nobody understands what you're going through as a mom or dad of a child who has/had drug addiction affect their life- JOIN our group!
The only thing worse than going through something bad, is going through something bad ALONE.
We'll plan times to talk and share experiences, advice and resources.
We'll also plan times when we can just take a 'day off' from the worries and go have a little fun with our new found friends that understand you better than anyone else in your life.
results.name: Greensburg Parents of Addicts Support Group-You're NOT alone

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in gaming. We meet at The Lightning Bug in Mars, PA to play all kinds of games. We play traditional card games (like cribbage, rummy, spades, hearts, euchre, bridge), modern and traditional board games (euros and american-style board games, backgammon), and modern card games (like dominions, other deck-builders, LCGs, social deduction games etc). We meet in one or several of The Lightning Bug private party rooms when they are not used for birthday parties. The Lightning Bug is a family entertainment center (bumper cars, laser tag, glow golf, arcade, playground) with three large private party rooms that can accommodate more than 20 persons each.
results.name: Mars, PA Games Meetup Group

results.description: Suffering in silence about having a pelvic organ prolapse?  As you may know, you are not alone although you may feel like it.  Let's work together to remove the embarrassing stigma of this condition and to find the solutions to making us feel whole again.

topics.name: Support Group for People and Families of Epilepsy

results.description: This is a support group for people who have epilepsy, or seizure disorder. Topics included, but not limited to: medications, side effects, and doctors. We'll talk about making friends you can trust, getting involved in healthy activities (like exercise and yoga), getting enough sleep, and drinking plenty of water. We'll talk about work, school, and the process of obtaining a license with seizure disorder. 1 in 26 people are diagnosed with epilepsy at some point in their life. You're not alone. We'd love to hear your story.
results.name: Epilepsy Support and Awareness Group of Beaver County

results.description: Hello! I am looking for people in the east meaning Monroeville, Penn Hills, Plum, Turtle Creek, North Versailles, the suburbs of Pittsburgh East. People who would like to walk, for weight loss, stress relief, personal fitness etc. We can do other activities in this group to get your body and mind in shape! If you are just starting out please join me as I am just starting out. If you have been walking for a while that's great! We would be glad for you to join us as long as you don't mind walking at a slower pace. Our meet ups will be held in and around the East suburb area of Pittsburgh. There are some very nice places to walk,ride bikes in the east. So lets go for a walk
results.name: Pittsburgh East Walkers

results.description:
This group and online resources will help prepare you for a long-term grid power blackout, or almost any mega-disaster. We've developed a viral strategy that can protect Pittsburgh and then the entire country. One theme is to insure yourself and then move on with your life. A small amount of effort and education can go a long way!

You should join if you want access to free disaster preparedness information, and if you'd like to mobilize to protect yourself, loved ones and the country.  Unlike many prepper groups, our emphasis is on a solution that protects the entire country  -- because otherwise the survivors would be living in an emotionally traumatized and economically crippled country.

Instead, we believe that a chain reaction of people doing preparation, supporting others to prepare, and pushing government to prepare for those who can't afford to prepare can rapidly protect the country. 

Most people who learn about the grid problem get emotionally overwhelmed or feel despair, but we've found that meaningful action displaces negative feelings and replaces them with positive feelings, such as higher self-esteem when you learn information and skills that will protect yourself.

A lot of useful information and videos can be found at our main website, GridEmergency.Org
results.name: Grid Emergency (America Mobilizes)
